other_tests.findings: Extensive but not diffuse effacement of foot processes with minimal chronic changes of the parenchyma and 12% global glomerulosclerosis.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Suggestive of idiopathic minimal-change disease; extensive effacement of foot processes indicates an early stage or partial remission.
Protein-to-creatinine ratio decreased to 1.4, with resolution of edema and furosemide discontinued after treatment.

other_tests.findings: Total urine T4 level was 2.14 μg per deciliter; calculated 24-hour T4 excretion was 62 μg.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Confirmed that clinical hypothyroidism was attributable to nephrotic syndrome; monitored over time.
After treatment with prednisone, the ratio declined to 0.1, indicating resolution of nephrotic syndrome.
